item.title: Alexey Guzey

Alexey Guzey on Twitter

“.@gothamchess https://t.co/T4Hhbv4KoX says that AlphaZero really loves sacrificing pieces for speed & initiative. “AZ loves suppressing movement.” Web-based stockfish thinks AZ does dumb moves. Why? Because SF evaluates piece adv. If you zoom out, “dumb moves” are actually smart.”

URL: https://twitter.com/alexeyguzey/status/1561429769689960453

item.title: Jon Askonas
item.description:
Jon Askonas on Twitter

“Short written assignments are FINISHED pedagogically. Educators need to wake up to this reality. There are alternatives: in-class blue books, oral exams, longer research papers (for now). But AI forces us to rethink our pedagogy. This took me 10 seconds in GPT-3.”

URL: https://twitter.com/JonAskonas/status/1562074612866883584

item.title: Nabeel
item.description:
Nabeel on Twitter

“Reminded of what John Carmack said recently -- if no Elon, we won’t get to Mars anytime soon, because SpaceX’s existing business is lucrative and scalable and the Mars thing won’t make financial sense for a very long time. It’s only going to happen because he’s pushing for it”

URL: https://twitter.com/nabeelqu/status/1560319824286420998

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022

item.title: Nathan Baugh
item.description:
Nathan Baugh on Twitter

“Remember the copywriting Apple used to get consumers to opt out of ad tracking? Well, their own ask to track you reads quite different (h/t @sethmills21). Bonus points for the highlighted “Turn on personalized ads” 🙄”

URL: https://twitter.com/nathanbaugh27/status/1560247262042791936

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022

item.title: Nathan Baugh
item.description:
Nathan Baugh on Twitter

“Why the outperformance? Because of a quirk with iOS 14.5. The update prevents sharing of data between different parties (i.e. Facebook accessing data from other apps). It does not prevent the exchange of data within a single platform. Apple is that single platform.”

URL: https://twitter.com/nathanbaugh27/status/1560247266153308161

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022

item.title: Nathan Baugh
item.description:
Nathan Baugh on Twitter

“I don’t blame Apple. Their ad network will be a $10B+ rev stream. But it’s important to understand the tradeoffs. Apple: • Weaponized a narrative to harm competitors • Crushed small businesses in the process • Bolstered their ad biz And yes, they’re still using your data.”

URL: https://twitter.com/nathanbaugh27/status/1560247267499573255

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022

item.title: Niko McCarty
item.description:
Niko McCarty on Twitter

“Ribosomes can make more ribosomes outside of a living cell. There are 54 genes that encode the myriad parts to build a ribosome. Now, each of them can be mutated in vitro to quickly build ribosomes with “enhanced functionality.” https://t.co/8MhQ2hrr8k”

URL: https://twitter.com/NikoMcCarty/status/1566035032174723073

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022

item.title: Reconstitution of ribosome self-replication outside a living cell
item.description:
URL: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2022.08.29.505692v1

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022

item.title: Nick Bloom
item.description:
Nick Bloom on Twitter

“The shift to WFH is the largest shock to labor markets in decades. Pre-pandemic WFH was trending towards 5% of days by 2022. Now WFH is now stabilizing at 30%, a 6-fold jump. In America alone this is saving about 200 million hours and 6 billion miles of commuting a week.”

URL: https://twitter.com/I_Am_NickBloom/status/1564236320259461120

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022

item.title: Ken Kocienda
item.description:
Ken Kocienda on Twitter

“I’ve tweeted about this before, but when we made the original iPhone, we didn’t have product managers. We had directly responsible individuals (DRIs). Each important piece of work had a single person charged with seeing to it that the work got done. 1/”

URL: https://twitter.com/kocienda/status/1563917075189358593

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022

item.title: Nathan Taylor
item.description:
Nathan Taylor on Twitter

“If you haven’t been following this, quite interesting. Replacing/diluting your blood plasma seems to make mice (and in this paper 3 people) younger. Obviously caution is warranted. But a line of research to worth paying attention to. https://t.co/lTtVuPLNaX”

URL: https://twitter.com/ntaylor963/status/1563911358650888193

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022

item.title: Old plasma dilution reduces human biological age: a clinical study - GeroScience
item.description:
URL: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11357-022-00645-w

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022

item.title: Patrick McKenzie
item.description:
Patrick McKenzie on Twitter

“I broadly think this is true. There are also some interesting mostly unacknowledged filters on particular health statuses. (Some things which are diagnosable and treatable are actually selected *for* at certain margins; many others are brutally selected against.)”

URL: https://twitter.com/patio11/status/1563257387813064704

source: Best of Twitter - August 22-Sep 11, 2022
